sections.name: Web
sections.description: My career's focus circles around web-development. I have primarily worked on projects for the web using a variety of tools and languages. Even though my experience is limited to deploying monolith projects I have explored and written research concerning various system designs such as microservices, event-driven, and other more scalabe architectures. I have worked with various deployment platforms such as Vercel, Firebase and Heroku. My expertise extends beyond simple websites, encompassing the development of browser extensions, basic cybersecurity obtained through experiences like Hack The Box challenges, and the creation of immersive 3D experiences.

sections.name: Cross-platform
sections.description: Mostly for personal projects I have developed and used apps on all popular platforms, but I have spent most time working on Linux, Windows, and Android. One of the apps is available on Google Play Store.

sections.name: Low-level systems
sections.description: My curiousity in the internal workings of code combined with my desire to write efficient programs brought me to the world of memory management, tcp connections, terminals... I was guided mostly by interest, so fewer projects of mine are connected with this section.

sections.name: A1 Internship
sections.description: My first internship was at one of the largest telecomunication companies in Bulgaria. It was a project lead by the Belgian branch with the help of a Bulgarian team, in which I took part. Its objective was mainly structured around selecting the content for TV programs. My tasks varied between working on the front- and backend.

sections.name: SDG Challenge
sections.description: The SDG (Sustainable Developement Goals) are a set of goals defined by UN (United Nations) meant to make the world a better place. The challenge is organized a coulple of times a year in different countries. The aim is to work with large companies on one or a few SDGs in order to help the company lower their emissions, improve its employees' quality of life... My assigned establishment was Sabic. This is the second biggest plastic producer and a leading industry in agriculture, transportation, packaging, technology and more.

sections.name: Latin is simple
sections.description: Owned by two Austrian graduates this language learning app has gained dozens of thousands of users over the years. It is primarily used by students learning Latin. It provides tools such as learning trainers, sentence analisys, and many more.

sections.name: Information club “Digital Studio”
sections.description: This is an ethnic diversity cooperation project with "St. Paisiy Hilendarski" School. I was offered to participate by my IT teacher at my highschool and I worked side by side with students from different grades.

education.value: The Breakthrough UI Developer Process Web Class by Pete Heard
NodeJS - The Complete Guide (MVC, REST, APIs, GraphQl)

books.title: The Rust Programming Language
books.subTitle: Covers Rust 2018
books.author: Steve Klabnik and Carol Nichols
books.description: The official book on the Rust programming language, written by the Rust development team at the Mozilla Foundation, fully updated for Rust 2018

books.title: C Programming Language
books.subTitle: 2nd Edition
books.author: Brian Kernighan and Dennis Ritchie
books.description: The complete guide to ANSI standard C language programming, written by the developers of C.
books.cover: C Programming Language, 2nd Edition by Brian Kernighan.jpg

books.title: Clean Code
books.subTitle: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
books.description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn't have to be that way.
books.author: Robert C. Martin
books.cover: Clean Code by Robert C. Martin.jpg

books.title: Software Architecture Patterns
books.subTitle: 2nd Edition
books.author: Mark Richards
books.description: The success of any software application or system depends on the architecture style you use. This updated report presents several common architecture styles to guide designers and developers on how to design components and to help you determine the ways in which those components should interact.

books.title: System Design Interview
books.subTitle: An insider's guide
books.author: Alex Xu
books.description: This book provides a step-by-step framework for how to tackle a system design question. It includes many real-world examples to illustrate the systematic approach, with detailed steps that you can follow.

books.title: Design Patterns
books.subTitle: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
books.author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides
books.description: Capturing a wealth of experience about the design of object-oriented software, four top-notch designers present a catalog of simple and succinct solutions to commonly occurring design problems. Previously undocumented, these 23 patterns allow designers to create more flexible, elegant, and ultimately reusable designs without having to rediscover the design solutions themselves.

books.title: Code
books.subTitle: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software
books.author: Charles Petzold
books.cover: Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software.jpg
books.description: Dives into the fundamental concepts of computer science, starting from basic electrical circuits to the intricate workings of modern computers. The book explores how simple ideas and technologies evolve into complex systems, making the world of computing accessible and engaging for both technical and non-technical readers.

books.title: Refactoring
books.subTitle: Improving the Design of Existing Code
books.author: Martin Fowler, with Kent Beck
books.description: The guide to how to transform code with safe and rapid process, vital to keeping it cheap and easy to modify for future needs.

books.title: Clean Coder
books.subTitle: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers
books.author: Robert C. Martin
books.description: Programmers who endure and succeed amidst swirling uncertainty and nonstop pressure share a common attribute: They care deeply about the practice of creating software. They treat it as a craft. They are professionals.

entities.value: "The Last Algorithms Course You'll Need" by The Primeagen
